*(Carnage wanted me to tell everyone that he's sorry for missing certain 
posts, and plans on replying to all of them as soon as possible. He also 
wanted everyone to disregard the end of his last post, instead of going to 
beast mode, Dinobot is still in robot mode and just waiting. That's about 
it.

Oh, CODE, I did post damage for Tavatron, but I made it general and didn't 
list any names because I had missed an entire day of posting and thus most 
of the battle. I didn't want to confuse anyone, that's all. Sorry for any 
inconvience^_^)*

Tavatron stared past Dinobot as the newly formed battlefield. In some odd 
way she felt rather at home here, though it no longer held the quiet beauty 
it once did. She was used to battle and it's casulties, whether they be 'bot 
or peaceful land. This was part of who she was, a warrior. However, that 
didn't mean she had to like it.

Tavatron turned back to face Dinobot, not knowing that she was on his blind 
side. Her own eyesight was still blurry, but nothing she couldn't handle. 
Her shoulder was the main problem. If she couldn't rotate it without causing 
further damage then she was at a loss. The throbbing had already begun to 
subside, only to be replaced with an occasional spark when she tried to move 
it. The sound of Dinobot's voice caused her to snap her wandering optics in 
his direction:

"I apologize. I hadn't realized you had a blind side."

Tavatron's voice was cool and confident, there was nothing else she could 
think of to say at the moment. All she wanted to do was get back to base and 
spend a couple of cycles in an 'R chamber. Then her ears perked at what 
Dinobot said next, how all that was left was her concern. Was she THAT 
transparent? She had always had a degree of control over her emotions, why 
now did she find it so difficult to keep them in check?

Tavatron looked to the side and pulled her ears back in slight distress. She 
didn't like this, she didn't like feeling as if she had no control over 
herself, over her actions. Slag it! She was a warrior, not a den mother! Her 
beast mode's instincts must be screwing with her programing again. Wolves 
were always worried about their packmates.

However, deep down, Tavatron knew this wasn't true, she just didn't want to 
have to deal with it right now. She wrote it off as faulty programming and 
quickly righted her ears and turned to face Dinobot. All trace of emotion 
was wiped from her face. She was beginning to retreat behind barriers she 
thought no longer existed. Perhaps in war there really was no room for 
foolish emotions:

"Whenever you're ready we can leave. I'm sure Prowl and the others will want 
to depart as well. Obliteracon doesn't look like he's about to be beaten 
anytime soon."

The giant Gestalt barely even looked fazed as Prowl and a few other 'bots 
tried their best to fight him off. She would have gladly joined the battle, 
but found herself reluctant to leave Dinobot alone. Why, she didn't have a 
clue, but somehow she knew it was more than faulty programming, she just 
didn't want to admit it to herself... yet.
